description: Borrowed from Late Latin creativus, from Latin creō. Equivalent to create +‎ -ive. Displaced native Old English orþanclīċ.

adjectives.description: creative (comparative more creative, superlative most creative)

entries.meaning: Tending to create things, or having the ability to create; often, excellently, in a novel fashion, or any or all of these.
examples: a creative dramatist who avoids cliche

entries.meaning: (of a created thing) Original, expressive and imaginative.
examples: a creative new solution to an old problem

entries.meaning: (set theory) A type of set of natural numbers, related to mathematical logic.
Designed or executed to deceive or mislead.
(countable) A person directly involved in a creative marketing process.
(uncountable) Artistic material used in advertising, e.g. photographs, drawings, or video.
examples: The design team has completed the creative for next month's multi-part ad campaign.
I've included in my portfolio all the creative I've completed in my five year design career.
